medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred at age 30 in 1988 with a hematocrit value within the upper end of the normal range. Over time, phlebotomy was initiated to maintain hematocrit below 45%. In 2001, a para-aortic mass was discovered, confirmed as a paraganglioma, and resected. After tumor resection in 2004, suspicion of recurrence arose due to elevated urinary metanephrines and rising hematocrit levels, confirmed by imaging.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Homozygous for the C282Y mutation in the hemochromatosis gene HFE; treated mild hypertension with atenolol.
medical_history.family_history: His brother was also found to be homozygous for the C282Y mutation and is undergoing treatment for hemochromatosis. No erythrocytosis or tumors were found in any other family members.
